results.title: The Islands: Watery Outposts of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
A visually stimulating look at a wide variety of Australian island habitats and wildlife, both above and below the tide line. Aerial, surface and underwater photography explores the world of the birds, reptiles, mammals and fish that inhabit the islands and coral reefs. Prominently featured is one of Australia’s natural wonders - the Great Barrier Reef.

results.title: The Islands of Torres Strait
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
Torres Strait is a treacherous waterway between Cape York, the northern most tip of the Australian mainland and Papua New Guinea. The shallow strait is dotted with Islands and coral outcrops. From Possession Island at the southern extremity, Captain James Cook formally laid claim to the Australian colonies in the name of England. Later the Queensland Government moved to control the Islands of the Strait and their people. Once, the islanders currency of trade was human heads, and headhunting raids between the islands and mainland Papua New Guinea was part of life. On this journey through the islands, Ted Egan meets some old friends, sees dugout canoes being built and meets the keeper of the legendary Drums of Mer.

results.title: The Islanders
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description: Aspects of life in the Torres Strait Islands, showing the rich culture of the people with their songs and dances, set against bright tropical backgrounds, in striking contrast to many parts of Australia. Shows how strongly the old traditions still affect the people, even though they have modern schools, shops, out-board motors and transistors.

results.title: The Island of Nevawuz
results.creator_credit: Fable Films Productions and Paul Williams
results.brief_description: Nevawuz is an idyllic and underdeveloped island in danger of corruption. J.B. Trumphorn, a corporate boss attempts to industrialize the island by using it’s natural source of oil. Aided by the King’s nephew his plan works, polluting the island as a result. Resistance to Trumphorn comes in the form of the young islander, Otto, and his dog Spot, who lead the islanders in a defence of Nevawuz. An instructive and entertaining video for children on the issue of pollution and industrialization. The video also includes “The True story of Ned Kelly” and “Ned Kelly’s dastardly dilemma”. All three tales are written and produced by Paul Williams.

results.title: The Island of Dr Moreau
results.creator_credit: Edward Pressman, New Line Cinema and John Frankenheimer
results.brief_description: Dr. Moreau is brilliant geneticist on the brink of superseding evolution. When a UN diplomat visits the island laboratory he discovers experiments turning animal life forms into human-like beasts. The beasts revolt, threatening not only the island but ultimately all mankind.

constellations_other.name: Doctors of Evil
constellations_other.description: Villains get all the best lines and if they're mad scientists, they get all the best toys too. Evil Dr Ironstein from Flight of the Amazon Queen is one member of long lineage of science supervillains.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward Pressman, New Line Cinema and John Frankenheimer
results.description: Dr. Moreau is brilliant geneticist on the brink of superseding evolution. When a UN diplomat visits the island laboratory he discovers experiments turning animal life forms into human-like beasts. The beasts revolt, threatening not only the island but ultimately all mankind. Adapted from the H.G. Wells story. Cast includes Val Kilmer, Marlon Brando, David Thewlis, Fairuza Balk, Ron Perlman, Temuera Morrison.

results.title: The Island
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Richard Zanuck, David Brown and Michael Ritchie
results.brief_description: Based on Peter Benchley’s novel and adapted for the screen by him, “The Island” unfortunately does not match up to Benchley’s box office hit “Jaws”. The story is set in the Caribbean, in the Bermuda Triangle, an area where pleasure crafts and fishing boats have a habit of mysteriously disappearing, along with their passengers and crew. Blair Maynard (Michael Caine) is a journalist who sets out, along with his son, Justin (Jeffrey Frank), to try and discover the reason for the disappearances. It is during a fishing trip in the accursed area that Maynard and his son are captured by pirates, who are supposedly descendants from seventeenth century pirates and who still live by the same code, that is, robbing and murdering all those who sail close to their island shores. Maynard is kept alive to serve the needs of “regenerating” the blood-line of the pirates, and Nau, King of the pirates (David Warner), takes to converting Justin to their heathen ways. But escape for Maynard becomes paramount and the action and thrills begin to build as the film heads towards its tumultuous climax. Cast also includes Angela Punch McGregor, Frank Middlemass, Don Henderson, Dudley Sutton, Colin Jeavons. Music composed and conducted by Ennio Morricone.

results.title: The Isa
results.creator_credit: Andrew J. Helgeson, Cinesound and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: A documentary about Mt Isa produced in 1969. The Isa, 30 minutes. Produced for the Mt. Isa Mines Ltd. Mt. Isa mine and city as seen by business men, tourists and residents enjoying life in this new and ever developing mining city in Northern Queensland.

results.title: The Iron ladies
results.brief_description: Camp comedy, based on a true story, about a group of gay and transsexual men who join a volleyball team and are led to victory by an unassuming but determined coach. Drawing comic conflict from the protagonists preening and interpersonal problems, the film travels a fairly standard arch regarding tolerance difference and overcoming seemingly insurmountable odds. A huge hit in Thailand, this film also played in numerous festivals, including Toronto Film Festival. Followed by a sequel The Iron ladies 2 in 2003.

results.title: The Iron giant
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Allison Abbate, Des McAnuff and Brad Bird
results.brief_description: A loving homage to fifties science fiction movies, Brad Bird’s animated “The Iron giant” has a strong sense of that era’s unerring innocence mixed with the looming paranoia of the unfamiliar ‘other’. Based on the 1968 children’s story “Iron man” by British poet laureate Ted Hughes, the film’s archetypal story of fear and prejudice depicts the unusual friendship between a nine year old boy called Hogarth Hughes (voiced by Eli Marienthal) and a giant robot that mysteriously lands in small town Maine circa 1958. The town’s suspicious adults greet the enigmatic visitor with open hostility, pushing the young boy into a protective role with the misunderstood giant. When nosy government agents descend upon the town in search of the robot, Hogarth begins to find hiding the car-eating giant a challenging task. Brad Bird laces this wonderful children’s fantasy with a strong political parable about the cold war fear that permeated every aspect of American society and includes a hilarious cartoon version of the now infamous educational film “Duck and cover”. Cast includes: Jennifer Aniston, Harry Connick JR, Vin Diesel, Cloris Leachman, John Mahoney, M. Emmet Walsh, Christopher McDonald.

results.title: The Irishman
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Forest Home Films and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Elizabeth O’Connor. Set in Northern Queensland in the 1920’s, it is the story of a proud Irish Australian teamster and his family as they face the competition from motorised transport. This is the story of a family experiencing events which they cannot control in the face of progress and change. Stars Michael Craig, Simon Burke, Robin Nevin and Bryan Brown.
